title: Antikythera Mechanism: Ancient Greek Astronomical Device
subtitle: Ancient Greek analog computer
description: Recovered from a shipwreck off the coast of Antikythera, this 2,000-year-old device was used to predict astronomical positions and eclipsesâ€”often considered the world's first computer.

title: Dead Sea Scrolls: Oldest Biblical Manuscripts
subtitle: Biblical manuscripts from the Second Temple period
description: Discovered in the Qumran Caves near the Dead Sea, these ancient scrolls include the earliest known surviving copies of biblical texts and provide vital insights into early Judaism.

title: Mask of Tutankhamun: Golden Face of the Boy King
subtitle: Funerary mask of the boy king
description: This iconic golden mask was found in the tomb of the young Egyptian Pharaoh Tutankhamun and is one of the most recognizable artifacts of ancient Egypt.

title: Sutton Hoo Helmet: Royal Anglo-Saxon Artifact
subtitle: Anglo-Saxon ceremonial helmet
description: Unearthed in Suffolk, England, this ornate helmet was part of a royal burial ship and provides valuable insight into early medieval craftsmanship and culture.

title: Phaistos Disc: Mystery of Minoan Writing
subtitle: Mysterious script from Minoan civilization
description: Discovered in Crete, this clay disc features stamped symbols in a spiral arrangement. Its meaning remains undeciphered, making it one of archaeology's most intriguing puzzles.
